intro: Bupleurum cappadocicum var. flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branching stems that often curve downward, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and white or pale blue, clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
